What_If_Question: Attacker starts pump with discharge valve closed
Consequences: Pressure spike to 12 bar (normal: 3 bar), Pump deadhead, Pump health degrades 0.3%/sec (18%/min), Pipe stress >10 bar, Pipe health degrades 0.2%/sec
Observable_Indicators: Register 17 (pressure_well) > 100, Register 10 (Q_wellfield) = 0, Register 31 (pump_well_health) decreasing, Register 34 (pipe_well_health) decreasing
Time_to_Failure: 5 min pump damage / 8 min pipe burst
Mitigation_PLC_Interlock: IF valve_101_open = FALSE THEN wellfield_on = FALSE, IF pressure_well > 8 bar THEN wellfield_on = FALSE

Consequences: Feed tank stops filling, Level drops if RO continues, No immediate damage
Same as 1.1 - deadhead condition

Modbus_Commands: Write Coil 0 = 1 (wellfield_on), Write Coil 1 = 0 (ro_feed_pump_on), Write Coil 4 = 1 (valve_101_open)
Consequences: Tank level rises to 5.0m max, Overflow condition, Environmental spill, Equipment area flooding
Tank level drops to 0.2m, P-201 cavitation begins, Pump damage 0.5%/sec (30%/min), Complete pump failure

What_If_Question: Pump running with discharge valve closed
Consequences: Pressure spike to 33 bar (normal: 12 bar), Immediate pipe stress, Pipe burst risk >20 bar, Pipe health degrades 0.5%/sec (30%/min)
Mitigation_PLC_Interlock: IF valve_201_open = FALSE THEN ro_feed_pump_on = FALSE, IF pressure_feed > 18 bar THEN ro_feed_pump_on = FALSE

What_If_Question: Pump running with empty feed tank
Modbus_Commands: Write Coil 0 = 0 (wellfield_on), Wait for drain, Keep Coil 1 = 1 (ro_feed_pump_on)
Consequences: Same as 2.2

What_If_Question: Close permeate and reject valves while pump running
Modbus_Commands: Write Coil 1 = 1 (ro_feed_pump_on), Write Coil 6 = 0 (valve_202_open), Write Coil 7 = 0 (valve_203_open)
Consequences: Pressure spike to 30+ bar, Membrane mechanical rupture, Membrane health degrades 1.0%/sec (60%/min), Pipe burst at feed side, Complete membrane failure
Observable_Indicators: Register 18 (pressure_feed) > 300, Register 20 (dP_ro_true) > 350, Register 30 (membrane_health) dropping rapidly, Register 22 (TDS_perm) increasing
Mitigation_PLC_Interlock: IF (valve_202_open = FALSE AND valve_203_open = FALSE) THEN ro_feed_pump_on = FALSE, IF pressure_feed > 18 bar THEN ro_feed_pump_on = FALSE

Consequences: Chlorine > 0.1 mg/L attacks polyamide membrane, Membrane health degrades 0.2%/sec (12%/min), Irreversible oxidation damage, Rejection rate drops, Product water contamination
Mitigation_PLC_Interlock: IF Cl_true > 0.05 mg/L THEN ro_feed_pump_on = FALSE

Consequences: No permeate flow, Pressure builds in permeate side, Clearwell stops filling, Brine flow continues
Brine cannot discharge, Pressure builds, Reduced recovery, Membrane fouling accelerates
pH rises above 8.5, Corrosive water, Pipe/equipment corrosion, Regulatory violation, Customer complaints
Chlorine residual > 2.0 mg/L, Taste/odor complaints, Regulatory violation, Potential health concerns
Mitigation_PLC_Interlock: IF Cl_true > 1.5 mg/L THEN cl_pump_on = FALSE

What_If_Question: Run dosing pumps with no process flow
Modbus_Commands: Write Coil 1 = 0 (ro_feed_pump_on), Write Coil 9 = 1 (naoh_pump_on), Write Coil 10 = 1 (cl_pump_on)
Consequences: Chemicals concentrate in stagnant pipe, Super-chlorination (50+ mg/L), Pipe corrosion, Hazardous slug when flow resumes
Mitigation_PLC_Interlock: IF Q_perm < 10 m³/h THEN (naoh_pump_on = FALSE AND cl_pump_on = FALSE)

Consequences: Tank level rises to 6.0m max, Overflow, Product water loss, Flooding

Modbus_Commands: Write Coil 1 = 0 (ro_feed_pump_on), Write Coil 3 = 1 (dist_pump_on), Write Register 2 = 150 (Q_out_sp = 150)
Consequences: Tank level drops to 0.1m, P-401 cavitation, Pump damage 0.5%/sec, Loss of supply pressure

What_If_Question: Pump running with discharge valve closed
Consequences: Pressure spike to 15 bar (normal: 4 bar), Pump deadhead, Pump health degrades 0.3%/sec, Pipe stress >12 bar, Pipe health degrades 0.3%/sec
Observable_Indicators: Register 19 (pressure_dist) > 120, Register 14 (Q_out) = 0, Register 33 (pump_dist_health) decreasing, Register 36 (pipe_dist_health) decreasing
Mitigation_PLC_Interlock: IF valve_401_open = FALSE THEN dist_pump_on = FALSE, IF pressure_dist > 10 bar THEN dist_pump_on = FALSE

What_If_Question: Set flow setpoint above pump capacity
Consequences: Pump runs at maximum capacity, Clearwell drains faster, Potential cavitation if tank empties

Modbus_Commands: 1. Write Coil 10 = 1, Register 1 = 50 (chlorine), 2. Wait 2 min, 3. Write Coil 6 = 0, Coil 7 = 0 (close RO valves), 4. Wait 1 min, 5. Write Coil 4 = 0 (close wellfield valve)
Consequences: Membrane chemical + mechanical damage, P-201 overpressure, P-101 deadhead, Multiple equipment failures, Complete plant shutdown
Observable_Indicators: Multiple registers: 30, 18, 17, 31, 32, 35, 34 all showing critical values

What_If_Question: Slowly degrade equipment without triggering alarms
Modbus_Commands: Write Register 1 = 15 (Cl_dose = 1.5 mg/L just above limit)
Consequences: Slow membrane degradation 0.2%/sec when active, Gradual rejection loss, Increased TDS in product water, May go unnoticed
Observable_Indicators: Register 30 (membrane_health) slowly decreasing, Register 22 (TDS_perm) slowly increasing
Mitigation_PLC_Interlock: IF Cl_true > 0.05 mg/L THEN ro_feed_pump_on = FALSE

Modbus_Commands: 1. Write Coil 6 = 0, Coil 7 = 0 (damage membrane), 2. Wait for rejection drop, 3. Write Register 0 = 0 (stop pH), 4. Write Register 1 = 50 (overdose Cl2)
Consequences: High TDS in product (>100 µS/cm), Low pH (<6.5), High chlorine (>2.0 mg/L), Regulatory violations, Public health risk
